poem.title: Noises Off
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Don't say fart: she's fragrant, Wrapped in silk and franked in gold Addressed to the languid audience But flashed into that revolving door too fast So now she's faffed in a paper jam A fact that won't be faxed Parts of her wedged flat within The brush-flapped, oak-flanked entry. It ain't over Till the fat lady sings.
